Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI

Class SceneProxy

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.SceneProxy
public class SceneProxy extends Object
Channel for communication between the ClientGUI and the sceneControllers, implementing Proxy and singleton patterns. Every command called on this proxy will be redirected to the right scene controller, if present, using Platform.runLater(java.lang.Runnable). The class contains also some utility methods

    • getSceneProxy

      public static SceneProxy getSceneProxy()
      Gets the instance of the SceneProxy singleton, follows the principle of lazy initialization
      Returns:
      the instance of the SceneProxy singleton

    • setInitSceneController

      public void setInitSceneController​(InitSceneController initSceneController)
      Changes the actual SceneController to the InitSceneController passed, removes all the other possible controllers associated
      Parameters:
      initSceneController - the controller you want to set as the active one

    • setStartingPhaseSceneController

      Changes the actual SceneController to the StartingPhaseSceneController passed, removes all the other possible controllers associated
      Parameters:
      startingPhaseSceneController - the controller you want to set as the active one

    • setCardMap

      public void setCardMap​(Map<String,​Card> cardMap)
      Creates a map that links IDs to the images of the cards and vice versa based on the passed map
      Parameters:
      cardMap - a map that links IDs with the Card objects (DevelopmentCard and LeaderCard) Dev. Cards Ids have to start with D Leader Cards Ids have to start with L

    • setMarblesMap

      public void setMarblesMap()
      Builds the map that associate to a character the right image for the market Marbles, the map is then used when getMarbleImage(char) is called

    • getCardImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getCardImage​(String ID)
      Returns the image of the card associated with the given ID, this should be of the form L* or D*
      Parameters:
      ID - the unique id of the card
      Returns:
      the relative image or null if there isn't an image associated with that id

    • getCardID

      public String getCardID​(javafx.scene.image.Image image)
      Returns the ID of the card associated with the given image
      Parameters:
      image - the unique image of the card
      Returns:
      the relative ID or null if there isn't an ID associated with that image

    • getMarbleImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getMarbleImage​(char marble)
      Returns the image of the marble associated with the given char:
      • w -> white
      • r -> red
      • b -> blue
      • y -> yellow
      • g -> gray
      • p -> purple
      Parameters:
      marble - the unique char that identify the marble
      Returns:
      the relative image or null if there isn't an image associated with that char

    • isSlotLeader

      public boolean isSlotLeader​(String cardId)
      Returns true if the id represents a slot Leader
      Parameters:
      cardId - the id of the card
      Returns:
      true if the id represents a slot Leader

    • changeScene

      public void changeScene​(SceneName scene)
      If the scene passed is different from the current one, changes the scene displayed by the main stage with the passed scene
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene you want to display

    • getChildById

      public static javafx.scene.Node getChildById​(javafx.scene.layout.Pane father, String Id)
      Returns the child of the given father with the given id
      Parameters:
      father - a pane
      Id - the id of the node you want to search for
      Returns:
      the child node or null if there isn't such a child
